headline.main: THIRTY-THIRD CONGRESS....Second Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The death of Senator NORRIS was announced whereupon Mr. TOUCKY arose and said: Mr. PRESIDENT--It falls to my lot to perform the melancholy task of announcing to the Senate the death of one of its members. Hon. Mr. NORRIS, Senator from New-Hampshire, is no more. He died at his lodgings in this city, of an affection of the heart, on Thursday evening at 11 1/2 o'clock.
docs.snippet: The death of Senator NORRIS was announced whereupon Mr. TOUCKY arose and said: Mr. PRESIDENT--It falls to my lot to perform the melancholy task of announcing to the Senate the death of one of its members. Hon. Mr. NORRIS, Senator from New-Hampshire,...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Savannah, flag-ship of the squadron, arived at Rio de Janeiro Nov. 26, from Montevideo, whence she sailed on the 11th of that month. It was expected she would return to the La Platta in January.
docs.snippet: The Savannah, flag-ship of the squadron, arived at Rio de Janeiro Nov. 26, from Montevideo, whence she sailed on the 11th of that month. It was expected she would return to the La Platta in January.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 'Longshoremen's N. B. Society held a general meeting on Tuesday evening, at the Shakspeare Hotel, to take into consideration the difficulty that exists between some of the men and their employers, in relation to wages.
docs.snippet: The 'Longshoremen's N. B. Society held a general meeting on Tuesday evening, at the Shakspeare Hotel, to take into consideration the difficulty that exists between some of the men and their employers, in relation to wages.

headline.main: CITY REFORMS.; SPECIAL MESSAGE OF MAYOR WOOD. Recommendations Concerning Departments. SUGGESTIONS TOUCHING PAUPERS. City Railroad Cars to be More Heavily Taxed. Police--Elections--Central Park--Public Buildings. LETTER TO PRESIDENT PIERCE,

docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Wood last evening transmitted to the Board of Aldermen the following Special Message--its length making amends for the remarkable brevity of his Inaugural. There are various recommendations in regard to the Departments of the City Government. The Message is worth reading attentively: To the Honorable the Common Council of the City of New-York:

headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIC, OPERATIONS BEFORE SEBASTOPOL SALLIES OF THE GARRISON. OPENING OF THE FRENCH ASSEMBLY. SPEECH OF THE EMPEROR. French Loan of 500,000,000 Francs. IMPORTANT DIPLOMATIC CONFERENCE. Prussia, and Her English Envoy. STATE OF THE BRITISH ARMY IN THE CRIMEA. PARLIAMENT PROROGUED. FOREIGN ENLISTMENT BILL PASSED. Markets Quiet---Cotton Unchanged---Consuls 91??.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Baltic, from Liverpool early on Saturday morning, 30th of December, arrived at this port at 3 o'clock yesterday. The Africa arrived at Liverpool on Sunday, 24th December, at 121/2 o'clock, noon.

docs.lead_paragraph: The pacific Mail Steamship Company's steamer John L. Stephens sailed from San Francisco 16th December, at 9.30 a. M. and from Acapulco the 24th, at 1 o'clock A. M; arrived in Panama 20th December. at 4 o'clock A. M. Dec. 23. at 2 o'clock P. M. 60 miles above Acapulco, passed steamer Sonura, from Panama, bound to San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: Arrest of Engine-House Loafers. The Chief of Police in Brooklyn, with Captain McCALL and a posse of the Police of the Fourth District, made a descent yesterday morning upon Engine-House, No. 5, in Canton-street near Myrtle-avenue, and arrested ten persons known as Engine-House Loafers, for violating a City ordinance.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Discourse on Romanism. The Veterans of 1812. Northwestern Dispensary. Fog and the Ferries. City Mortality. Extension of Albany-street. Meeting in the Park. Arrival of the Glasgow. COMMON PLEAS--SPECIAL TERM MARINE COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: The second discourse of the series on Romanism under the patror age of the American and Foreign Christian Union, was delivered last evening at the Church on Madison-square, by Rev. Dr. ADAMS, from the following text: "One day with the Lord is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day."
